description: From Hindi घी (ghī) / Urdu گھی‎ (ghī), from Sanskrit घृत (ghṛta, “sprinkled”). Attested in English since the late 17th century. Related to Christ and grime via Proto-Indo-European.

entries.meaning: A type of clarified butter used in South Asian cooking; usli ghee.

examples: There are two kinds of ghee. Usli ghee or clarified butter is used rarely, partly because of its expense and partly because Indians consider it "heavy". The more commonly used ghee is a mixture of various vegetable oils.
